etymologies: late Middle English (denoting the rear part of an army): from Old French rereguarde

definitions: the soldiers positioned at the rear of a body of troops, especially those protecting an army when it is in retreat

examples.text: the firing from our rearguard had stopped

shortDefinitions: soldiers at rear of body of troops

definitions: a defensive or conservative element in an organization or community

examples.text: the academies acted as powerful guardians of the rearguard

shortDefinitions: reactionary or conservative element in organization or community
